Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure CLI
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Azure CLI to create an ExpressRoute Direct circuit. This involves specifying the ExpressRoute port, resource group, SKU family, SKU tier, bandwidth, and location.

Tasks.Task: Create ExpressRoute Direct using Azure Portal
Tasks.Task Description: Navigate to the Azure portal, search for ExpressRoute Direct, and follow the steps to create a new ExpressRoute Direct resource by specifying the subscription, resource group, region, and other configuration details.
Generate the LOA for the ExpressRoute Direct resource using the Azure CLI by specifying the resource name, resource group, customer name, and optionally the file location to store the document.
Enable or disable the admin state for primary and secondary links of the ExpressRoute Direct port using the Azure CLI.
Monitor and track the provisioned and utilized bandwidth for the ExpressRoute Direct circuits to ensure optimal usage and performance.
Follow the workflow to set up ExpressRoute Direct, including configuring peering locations, bandwidth, and encapsulation types.
Ensure all prerequisites are met and follow the checklist for setting up ExpressRoute, including finding a connectivity provider and reviewing best practices.
Assess and document the network security requirements for the ExpressRoute Direct setup, including regulatory requirements, user authorization, and authentication needs.
Set up routing for the ExpressRoute circuit, including configuring BGP and ensuring proper routing between on-premises and Azure.

Tasks.Task: Link a VNet to an ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Link a virtual network (VNet) to the ExpressRoute circuit to enable private connectivity between Azure and on-premises networks.
